subject: Actors, Actors Everywhere
event: The big HBO fact sheet, seen below, announced a whole bunch of new castings. Too many for me to discuss all at once, unless I wanted to devote the whole day to it. Which I don't. I have a big monkey to wrestle. Let me say a few words about a few, however. (I'll get to the others in good time). In the part of Marillion the singer (who is NOT named after the band), we have EMUN ELLIOTT, a young Scottish actor who has recently appeared in BLACK DEATH with Sean Bean. He could almost pass for a member of the Night's Watch in that gear, I think. His other credits include MONARCH OF THE GLEN and an SF crime drama called PARADOX. EMUN ELLIOTT He did not actually play the lute in his auditions, so I can't say whether he will be singing his own songs when that time comes. As Maester Aemon, we have PETER VAUGHAN, another truly amazing British character actor with a resume that stretches back to 1954 and includes appearances in such classic films as THE 39 STEPS, VILLAGE OF THE DAMNED, TIME BANDITS, THE FRENCH LIEUTENANT'S WOMAN, and many many more. He's worked with Alfred Hitchcock and Walt Disney, and his TV credits include everything from THE SAINT to THE PALLISERS to WAR AND REMEMBRANCE. He's going to be a sensational Maester Aemon. PETER VAUGHAN Equally distintinguished is the resume of the actress who will play Old Nan, one of Aemon's rivals for the title is oldest living resident of the Seven Kingdoms (Walder Frey is up there too, but he hasn't been cast yet). Her name is MARGARET JOHN. MARGARET JOHN Born and raised in Wales, Margaret John has been acting professionally since 1960. British audiences known her best for her recurring role as Doris in the television series GAVIN & STACY. SF fans may remember her from her appearances on DOCTOR WHO and BLAKE'S 7. But her credits go on and on forever, and her Old Nan was a delight. As for my latest round of clues... yes, you solved this one too. Give yourselves a pat on the head. You guys are impossible to fool for long. So let me confirm. The part of OSHA will be played by NATALIA TENA. NATALIA TENA "Arthur and Morgana are familiar with this wildling wench," I said. The wildling wench is Osha, of course. Natalia appeared with Jamie Campbell Bower in HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS and with Eva Green in WOMB. JBC will play Arthur and Eva Green will be Morgana in the new Starz series CAMELOT. "In the books she has not met Theon's sister (yet). Real life? Well... " Osha has not encountered Asha in the novels, no. But Natalia went to school with singer Lily Allen, the sister of Alfie Allen, who will play Theon in the series. "Actress and character both made a splash," I wrote. The scene used in the audition was the godswood scene where Bran comes on Osha bathing in the pool beneath the weirwood. And Natalie took a celebrated skinny dip during a music festival a year ago, as reported in the British press. Fantasy fans will know Tena best for her portrayal of the purple-haired Nymphadora Tonks in the Harry Potter films. When I saw that she was reading for Osha, my first thought was, "She's great, but no way, she's too young and too hot." Then I saw her reading, and none of the other Oshas had a chance. Her charisma grabbed me by the throat and I could not take my eyes off her. David and Dan felt the same way. We're all thrilled to have her. So that's four. Discuss amongst yourselves. My monkey is waiting.

comments.article:
Very cool to get Tena confirmed. The good Rabbit guessed that one.

I also have to say, learning earlier today that William FRACKIN Hobbs is helping Miltos Yerolemou get ready for his role as Syrio was kind of ... uh, jaw-dropping. He's a living legend. Rob Roy, Robin and Marian, The Duellists, Lester's Musketeers films, Dangerous Liasons... A ridiculous list of credits.

I wonder if he'll be choreographing any of the fights in the first season, or if he's just helping Miltos polish up his stage combat craft?
Peter Vaughan is such a brilliant actor.  I am so glad you got him.

OSHA LOOKS AMAZING

(others as well, of course. I know Vaughan - he's a terrific actor)
Question: So you've cast a number of Valemen; Lysa, Robin, Ser Hugh, Ser Vardis, etc. Conspicuously absent from this list is the Blackfish. Is he being shunted to next season?
good question

Maester Aemon was always Peter O'Toole in my head, ha. Oh well. :(

And yeah, I had the same feeling about that actress for Osha - too young and too hot! But okay, I'll trust you!

I thought the actress playing Osha looked familiar... it's no wonder I didn't really recognize her from the HP movies; her character was hardly in them. *duck*

I have to say, though, while I'm unfamiliar with most of the actors and actresses being cast, with every single one of them I've looked at their pictures and realized that, yes, I can definitely see them as the character they're playing. Especially with the recent castings of Littlefinger and Varys. @_@ There's a weird kind of dissonance that comes with seeing a character you know and love played by someone who looks nothing like how you pictured them; it's good to know that won't be happening with this series. Can't wait.
Natalia grabbed my attention in the Harry Potter movies, even with just a few very brief scenes.  She has great expressiveness.  I think she'll be dynamite.

Tonks?  We got Tonks!  That is awesome.  I am so infatuated with Tonks in the Harry Potter movies (even the books).  She gets nowhere near enough screen time.  Hopefully her role in GoT will change that. :)

Big fan of Nat Tena's here -- as I mentioned in my other comment in the other post, she's amazing in About a boy and Mrs Henderson Presents and she's got a good rep as a stage actress in the UK. Horribly underused in the Potter films though. She's also a bit of a mad woman in public appearances so not surprised that she blew everyone away as Osha. Woo hoo!

And Peter f'ing Vaughn as Maester Aemon?!! My fave role of his is probably in Brazil but he's brilliant in everything. Can't wait to see him!

Anyone who thinks that Natalia Tena would make a bad Osha (for whatever reason) should watch About a Boy. She's eve YOUNGER in that and pretty much plays the exact same character (only with cleaner clothes and a nose ring.)(And less tendency to murder people)And she was great in that.
comments.subject: Tonks/Osha

comments.article: If anyone is interested in seeing Peter Vaughan in a hilarious, but VERY un-Aemon-like, roll, check out the original British "Death at a Funeral". It's got our Tyrion in it, as well.
I love reading your thoughts on the casting as it progresses.  It's wonderful to see how incredibly excited you are and how invested you remain in the project.  You're an inspiration in every way.
Keep at that monkey ;-) Gotta say, even with all this amazing casting news, seeing Kong conquered will top it all!! You are the best! Rock on!
comments.subject: Your Monkey

comments.article: I have to agree. Even the mild mention of the monkey gets me excited. Dance updates perk my ears (eyes?) up instantly
comments.subject: Re: Your Monkey

comments.article:
Good choices!
(ZOMG Tena will make a good Osha!)

TONKS!!! That makes me unbelievably happy.

I need to order HBO soon.
I'm also very excited to see Mr. Martin's monkey....wait...we are talking about A Dance with Dragons here, right....?
comments.subject: Monkeys

comments.upictitle: no sticky, hot, messy, awful blood!: ≈ bsg › lee | a thousand yards
comments.article: Is that first photo an actual still from the series? 'Cause if so, WOW!

It's a still from BLACK DEATH.

Like I said.

Immediately above said photo.

I've never commented on GRRM's LiveJournal before, but having re-read the series recently I just felt like chiming in. All the casting choices seem pretty damn spot-on, though I'm not sure I can picture the scowly Old Guy from Braveheart as Jeor Mormont.

So where's Lord Beric and Thoros? They do appear in AGOT for one scene, when Ned sends them to kill the Mountain.
you are luckier with a monkey on your shoulder.what if it were a donkey?

Then she's already got some experience, let's see how she can do with a spear. I seem to remember her sticking it to Theon's man at some point.

This message contains multiple puns.

Anyone else noticed that Peter Vaughan is 87 years old? Although quite fitting for the role of ancient Maester Aemon who himself was still alive and kicking at the age of 102 (I think), it seems like a gamble to enlist Vaughan in a show that'll need him for the next 4 years or so (no disrespect intended).

Reminds me of a nice anecdote about an elderly women sitting in her front yard and telling people: "I'm 97 years old and finally life gets easier now that my daughter is in the nursing home." :D
comments.subject: Peter Vaughan

comments.article:
I have a quick question for George -
Is there any way to put forth suggestions for potential composers for the series, similar to how casting suggestions for David & Dan can be made over on the Westeros forums?
I'm not sure at what point they'll start seriously thinking about scoring the series, but I'd be very interested in tossing a few names their way if at all possible.
Thanks!
comments.subject: Composer for the HBO series

comments.article:
We have several composers in mind. In fact, the leading contenders have already been interviewed, and it's just a matter of making the final choice. (I have my own favorite).

Bottom line, it's probably too late to be tossing any new names into the hat. The composer will be one of those we've already interviwed.
comments.subject: Re: Composer for the HBO series
Re: Composer for the HBO series
Re: Composer for the HBO series

comments.article:
First of all, let me just say that i am VERY VERY excited about all the castings and developments taking shape for the HBO series GOT i cant wait for episode 1 of 10.

I have a question about KONG though, i'm sure it must have been answered in another posting at some point, but in case i missed it here's hoping i can still get the answer :)

Will A Dance with Dragons be available in Kindle edition immediately upon release? or will it come after?

G.R.R.M Master KONG SLAYER keep up the insanely fantastic & amazing work we all love and appreciate.

IKKP
comments.subject: HBO and Kong

comments.article:
Question concerning the show:

While you can leave most songs and prayers unsung in the books, won't the show require fuller versions (even just in the background)? If so, would you take on that task yourself in order to ensure continuity with possible future verses of staples like "Rains" and "the Bear," as well as some of the main prayers or hymns? Or would you leave it to the show's writers?

Sorry if you've answered this elsewhere.
- Vic
comments.subject: Songs and prayers
